title: Stock-market investors can’t shake tariff uncertainty. Trade deals hold the key.
description: Tariff uncertainty overwhelms upcoming data on the U.S. economy.

title: ‘I’m literally afraid to look at my balance’: I have $300K in a 2025 target-date fund. Is there a chance it will recover?
description: “I have no idea at this point how much I have lost.”

title: ‘I’m very cynical’: My stepmother, 85, makes bizarre requests for money from my father’s $10M trust. Should I be concerned?
description: “He used a crappy lawyer to set up a very boilerplate trust agreement.”

title: More tech heavyweights report after Alphabet offers some hope amid tariff fears
description: Earnings Watch: The earnings week ahead is enormous, and the fretting isn’t over yet.

title: 5 charts that show how Trump’s first 100 days have shaped Americans’ finances
description: Prices were relatively stable in Trump’s first months in office. Yet the stock market erased trillions in household wealth, and consumers are worried about the looming impact of tariffs.

title: Here’s how much money Shedeur Sanders lost out on by falling to the fifth round of the NFL draft
description: Sanders was once projected to go as high as No. 1 overall, with No. 3 overall to the New York Giants seemingly as low as he could go.

title: ‘I survived a head-on car wreck’: I’m on Medicaid, but inheriting $290K. How do I protect it from the 5-year look-back rule?
description: “About 30 years ago, I survived a head-on car wreck. I was put on 100% disability. I have not worked since.”

title: ‘An argument ensued’: My mother entrusted my inheritance to her second husband. That’s when it all went horribly wrong.
description: “He is a managing director at a major bank and probably clears $800,000 per annum.”

title: Where Trump’s tariffs and economic promises stand as he nears 100 days in office
description: As the 100-day mark nears for President Trump’s second term, here’s the status of key efforts that affect markets and your wallet.

title: Why airlines were already raising baggage fees even before travel demand started dropping
description: Airline passengers around the globe spend $33 billion on baggage fees — and now Southwest plans to start charging for the first time.
